body: Digital footwear workshop
title: Text Title

body:
Myer is one of the largest women’s footwear retailer in Australia, stocking over 70 brands in a breathtaking array of designer, contemporary, athletic, classic and comfort styles. We're a favourite shopping destination for women indulging their shoe obsession.


This learning moment examines the sizing standards in women’s footwear and exposes the must-have trends in footwear.
title: Text Title

body:
Myer uses three footwear sizing standards; European, UK, and Australian/USA. Imprinted inside the shoe or on the sole, and on the shoe box, the size number indicates the shoe length.


Work between the standards using size conversion charts found in the footwear reserve at your store. Ask a footwear team member if you’d like help locating it.
title: Accordion Title

_items.text:
SIZE SELLS


At Myer, 95% of women’s shoes sold are between size 6 and 10, so most styles only range in these sizes.


Selected styles range smaller or larger sizes, in particular, Urban Soul which has a collection developed in collaboration with Australian basketballer, Liz Cambage, and ranges up to size 15.

title: Text Input Title

body:
Women’s footwear usually come in an average width, also known as ‘B’ or ‘M’ fits. Where the width isn’t specified, you can assume the width is average.


American brands such as Nine West, Kylie & Kendall and Vince Camuto can have slightly narrower fits.


Hush Puppies and Easy Steps offer shoes in wider ‘C’ fits. The widest fit we sell is ‘D’ fit, available in the Widesteps brand.
title: Text Title

body: Press the image below to learn more.

_items.text:
TRY BEFORE YOU BUY


Sizes can vary between brands and styles, so it’s essential to try on shoes before buying them. For a realistic fit, shop in the evening as your feet can swell up to 8%.

title: Text Reveal Title

body:
To test shoes for fit, start by putting them on and standing up. They should feel comfortable, not bulge over the top or hang over the insole.


Next, walk in the shoes. There should be no pain - pressing, pinching, scraping, slipping or sliding are signs the shoe doesn’t fit well, so consider another size or style.


If they're slightly too big on one foot, then insoles, shoe cushions and heel grips are your secret weapon. They can help fill out the shoe, while providing extra comfort and repelling moisture.


Joanne Mercer

General Manager Womens Footwear & Accessories

title: GMCQ Title

_items.body: Lace up details are a must-have look, whether on peep toes, pumps or sandals.
Loafers are a casual shoe, shaped like a moccasin with a flat heel.
Mules are a backless shoe that can vary in height, have a closed toe, or peep toe like the one displayed.
Sneakers are a trend that never really went away. Wear them in white with metallic accents for an updated twist.
Espadrilles are a light canvas shoe with a rope covered flat or wedge heel. The natural textures give the shoe a casual look.

body: Here is a collection of other trending footwear styles. How many of these do you know?
title: Narrative Title

body:
There are many gorgeous styles to choose from this season, and my favourite is the Pomona sandal from Innovare Made in Italy. The laser cut detail on the leather gives it a beautifully updated look, and I’m in love with the unique woodgrain block heel.


Handcrafted in Italy with quality leather in the upper, lining and sole, this sandal fits like a glove on me.


Joanne Mercer

General Manager Womens Footwear & Accessories
title: Text Title

body:
In summary, the women’s footwear size conversion table available in every women’s footwear reserve makes it easy to work between AU/US, EU and UK size standards.

In addition, the footwear trends making a splash this season include:


- White sneakers

- Block, wedge and stacked heels

- Laser cut, cage and lace details

- Neutral tones and navy.
title: Text Title

body: To learn more about women’s footwear, check out the Footwear Construction learning moment or click the link below to explore our huge range of women’s footwear available online.
title: Link Title
